fullContent: Home› DriftDrift Hunters 2By OnlineGames.ioMake Game Full ScreenThe adrenaline rushing into your blood, a sense of accomplishment and stress relief... There are lots of reasons to love extreme sports like drifting. But what about the consequences, such as potential injuries, financial costs, or safety concerns? Not all of us have the money, courage or a safe environment to engage in highly dangerous extreme sports. But does that mean you won't feel that thrill ever? No, we don't think so. This is why we have brought the most exciting drift game to your door. Meet Drift Hunters 2, the second game of the fascinating game sequel. With enhanced graphics and more in-depth tuning, you will also be able to hunt for the highest drift scores. If you are ready, let's get into details!What is Drift Hunters 2?Drift Hunters 2 is a web-based driving game with premium 3D graphics and realistic physics. The game starts with a garage scene where you pick up your car, like in almost every other driving game. However, once you explore the vast number of vehicles, tuning, and map options, it will take you over for hours. 15 unique tracks, 26 epic cars in the garage and a very detailed tuning section are some of the awesome features the game offers.If you are familiar with the game and searching for a comprehensive guide on Drift Hunters 2 details, tricks and cheats, we covered all the aspects of the game, ranging from cheat codes, money hacks and garage options.How to Play Drift Hunters 2?You will start with a car similar to the Toyota Trueno (AE86) and 25K in your account at the beginning. You can use the money to buy a higher-performance car or tune the one you have.To see your options, head over to the cars section from the main menu. Tune your car as you like, pick a map and start drifting on the roads.You can view a list of garage and tuning options, maps and other features below.Tuning OptionsWhen you select the car, click on the tuning section. The tuning and customization section comprises 5 departments: Performance, stance, body paint, rims paint and wheels.Car PerformanceUpgrade your parts to experience the thrill on the track more. In the performance part, you can improve the most critical parts of your car: engine, turbo, gearbox, weight, suspension and brakes. Each has a vital role in performing a decent drift. You can see indicators of how much of the car's power, max speed, and shift time will change with each upgrade. So, you get to know exactly what you pay for.You can upgrade each part up to 4th level. These levels are stock, street, racing and pro, respectively.Some cars in the garage come with parts higher than the stock level. This means you can save tuning money by buying a better car.For example, R35 has a turbo on the 3rd level from the garage. A good option for those seeking power and speed in a car.StanceShifting the weight on time is critical in drifting. So, adjusting the stance of a car will improve your performance in the game. For example, raise the rear height to gain more Wall Tap bonuses. Experiment with the following measures and angles.If you're wondering what is the best tuning in Drift Hunters, read the full guide on Drift Hunters. Lower offset levels, negative camber, and higher heights are usually favored in drifting settings.Front heightFront camberFront offsetRear heightRear camberRear offsetBody and Rims PaintYou may have customized a few cars in online games before. But we are sure you didn't have these many options.Choose a color for your car using the color picker with brightness and shadow options. Apply a glossy, metallic, matte or chromatic coat on top of that. Your vehicle will look gorgeous.It's not just the body. You can also paint rims and make them shine.WheelsThe final part of the tuning section is the wheels. Choose rims that suit your car's style and your own. Sixteen different metallic rims are available.Drift Hunters CarsWe already mentioned you could find epic cars in this game, but what are they, and which real-life car brands do they resemble? Here are the answers:    AE86 - (Toyota Trueno GT-APEX)   S30Z - (Datsun 240Z)   S13 - (Nissan 240SX/180SX)   E30 - (BMW E30 M3)   GR - (Subaru Impreza WRX)   EVO - (Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution VIII)   E36 - (BMW E36 M3)   86 - (Toyota GT86)   s2000 - (Honda S2000 AP1)   S14 - (Nissan Silvia 240SX/200SX)   E46 - (BMW E46 M3)   S15 - (Nissan Silvia S15)   G35 - (Infiniti G35 Coupé)   FD3 - (Mazda RX-7 FD Type R FD3S)   FRS - (Ford Fiesta ST)  Z370 - (Nissan 370Z Coupé)   JZ90 - (Toyota Supra MKIV – JZA80)   E82 - (BMW 1M Coupé)   CLA - (Mercedes Benz AMG CLA 45)   GS - (Lexus GS)   R34 - (Nissan Skyline R34 GT-R)   GT500 - (Ford Mustang GT Fastback)   SXT - (Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat)   F82 - (BMW 3-Series)   R35 - (Nissan GTR)   993 - (RWB Porsche 911 993 GT)The Best Cars in Drift HuntersHowever, as gamers who spent many hours playing Drift Hunters 2, we decided to take it to the next level. We have calculated an index using the car's power, weight, max speed, score multiplier and price. The results are surprising. We have created a 2 list in terms of car performance solely and cost efficiency.When we took only the performance indicators into account, 5 high-performance cars stand out. Among these 5, the Porsche 993 outshines all cars with its low weight, engine power and acceleration speed.High-Performance Cars in Drift Hunters 2CarModelScore MPPower(hp)Weight(kg)Max Speed(km/h)Price99334401300270143,000 R3535061680270120,000 F822.84851530260115,000 SXT2.5550165027095,000 FRS2.1274115024043,000 On the other hand, this list of cost-efficient cars proves that you don't need to spend thousands to perform a decent drift. You can have a good, lightweight car even with the initial 25K in your account. The Honda S2000 wins this race with its max speed power and low price. Here is a list of the most cost-effective cars worth every penny you pay.Cost-Effective Cars in Drift Hunters 2CarModelScore MPPower(hp)Weight(kg)Max Speed(km/h)PriceS20001.7280124025520,000861.6275126524023,000E361.5270132025020,000S30Z1215107521012,000Drift Hunters 2 TracksThe game features 15 amazing tracks with unique views. We have divided tracks into 3 parts: playground, racetrack and touge.PlaygroundsPlaygrounds usually are flat surfaces with open fields where you can freely drive and drift. Perfect for training and experimenting with game physics. Among 5 playground maps, Countryside is the most convenient for a beginner.NevadaCountrysideOcean CityCity StreetsWaterfrontRacetracksRacetracks can be considered as 2nd level difficulty. You can come across a lot of hills and sharp turns on racetracks. 8 different racetracks are available in Drift Hunters 2; our favorite is definitely the slippery Icefield.Container YardFukushima HillsKarting LoopIcefieldNew ZealandOhioSpainGreen StoneTougeTouge is a Japanese term for passing a mountain. These roads are often narrow and created with S bends in a forest. Forest tracks are perfect for professional drifters seeking an extreme thrill. Akagi is the most difficult track in Drift Hunters according to many drifters.Fog MountainAkagiOther SettingsTo have a captivating gaming experience, having the ideal settings is essential. Before hitting the curvy roads, make your decisions on gearbox, graphics and volume.Gearbox: You can switch between manual and automatic gearbox. While professional drifters always choose the manual, it's completely okay to prefer casually hanging out with an automatic gearbox.Volume: Drift Hunters 2 has great sound effects where you can enjoy the squeezing sounds of drifting, engine throttle, crashes and many more. You can max the volume and enjoy the sounds fully. Or lower the volume so that you can also hear the music playing on your PC. Graphics: This one is highly critical for a smooth experience. You can choose between 3 levels of graphics: Low, medium and high. We recommend adjusting this setting according to your CPU, graphic card
